channel.title: BBC News - Asia
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Hardliners get key posts in new Taliban government
item.description: The all-male cabinet includes figures linked to attacks on US forces and a leader wanted by the FBI.

item.title: António Guterres says Taliban needs UN's humanitarian aid
item.description: In return, the new regime must provide conditions for the UN to work in Afghanistan, secretary general tells BBC.

item.title: Chinese social media site Weibo suspends 22 K-pop accounts
item.description: The social media site says 22 fan accounts have been suspended for "irrational celebrity support”.

item.title: Wirathu: Myanmar military releases firebrand Buddhist monk
item.description: Wirathu, dubbed the "Buddhist Bin Laden", is known for his anti-Muslim and pro-military views

item.title: Madhya Pradesh: Minor girls paraded naked in India 'rain ritual'
item.description: Six girls, some as young as five, were paraded naked as part of a village ritual to summon rainfall.

item.title: China court drops case against ex-Alibaba employee accused of sexual assault
item.description: The court said the "forcible indecency" committed by the man was not a crime.

item.title: Vietnam: Man gets five years in jail for spreading Covid
item.description: Le Van Tri was found guilty of spreading the virus to eight people in Vietnam, one of whom died.

item.title: Saipul Jamil: Row over sex offender appearing on Indonesian TV
item.description: A petition asking to keep Saipul Jamil off TV screens has been signed by nearly 500,000 people.

item.title: Scott Morrison: Australia PM criticised for Father's Day trip amid lockdowns
item.description: Scott Morrison is accused of "appalling judgment" for flying to Sydney while millions must stay home.

item.title: Audio of Ripper the 'talking' Australian duck rediscovered
item.description: The 1987 recording appears to show Ripper the Australian musk duck saying: "You bloody fool".

item.title: India jewellery ad starring trans model wins hearts
item.description: The ad is being praised in India where popular culture still portrays transgender people as caricatures.

item.title: Australian bush rescue: Mother's reunion with boy lost for four days
item.description: Three-year-old Anthony "AJ" Elfalak is recovering with family after going missing for four days.

item.title: The Taliban embrace social media: 'We too want to change perceptions'
item.description: Famed for their shunning of technology, the Taliban are realising they need to be on social media too.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban accused of killing pregnant police officer
item.description: The killing comes amid increasing reports of escalating repression of women in Afghanistan.

item.title: Planes stranded at Mazar-i-Sharif airport waiting to leave
item.description: A US lawmaker accuses the Taliban of not letting several planes of Afghans and Americans leave.

item.title: Afghanistan: The pledge binding al-Qaeda to the Taliban
item.description: The history of the complex relationship between the two groups.

item.title: Sunil Perera: Sri Lanka's larger than life music legend dies at 68
item.description: Sunil Perera was the frontman of The Gypsies - Sri Lanka's biggest musical franchise.

item.title: What election losers tell us about Indian democracy
item.description: Thousands of parties contest Indian polls but the rising participation masks a murky underbelly.

item.title: Joe Ferrari: The high-rolling life of Thailand's controversial ex-police chief
item.description: Joe Ferrari, who is said to own 42 cars, was last month pictured torturing a suspect to death.

item.title: Saving Australian frog species on the brink of extinction
item.description: Scientists fear four species are already extinct but say urgent action can save others.

item.title: Afghanistan: What's life like since the Taliban took over?
item.description: People around the country tell the BBC they have lost basic freedoms and are struggling to survive.

item.title: Why has Australia switched tack on Covid zero?
item.description: Australia is racing to vaccinate its population ahead of a huge shift in its pandemic strategy.

item.title: Afghanistan: What rise of Taliban means for Pakistan
item.description: Some Western powers hope that Pakistan could play a role as a mediator with the new Taliban government.
